1.text: “Surely there is a mine for silver and a place where gold is refined.

2.text: Iron is taken from the earth, and copper is smelted from ore.

3.text: Man puts an end to the darkness; he probes the farthest recesses for ore in deepest darkness.

4.text: Far from human habitation he cuts a shaft in places forgotten by the foot of man. Far from men he dangles and sways.

5.text: Food may come from the earth, but from below it is transformed as by fire.

6.text: Its rocks are the source of sapphires, containing flecks of gold.

7.text: No bird of prey knows that path; no falcon’s eye has seen it.

8.text: Proud beasts have never trodden it; no lion has ever prowled over it.

9.text: The miner strikes the flint; he overturns mountains at their base.

10.text: He hews out channels in the rocks, and his eyes spot every treasure.

11.text: He stops up the sources of the streams to bring what is hidden to light.

12.text: But where can wisdom be found, and where does understanding dwell?

13.text: No man can know its value, nor is it found in the land of the living.

14.text: The ocean depths say, ‘It is not in me,’ while the sea declares, ‘It is not with me.’

15.text: It cannot be bought with gold, nor can its price be weighed out in silver.

16.text: It cannot be valued in the gold of Ophir, in precious onyx or sapphire.

17.text: Neither gold nor crystal can compare to it, nor jewels of fine gold be exchanged for it.

18.text: Coral and quartz are unworthy of mention; the price of wisdom is beyond rubies.

19.text: Topaz from Cush cannot compare to it, nor can it be valued in pure gold.

20.text: From where, then, does wisdom come, and where does understanding dwell?

21.text: It is hidden from the eyes of every living thing and concealed from the birds of the air.

22.text: Abaddon and Death say, ‘We have heard a rumor about it.’

23.text: But God understands its way, and He knows its place.

24.text: For He looks to the ends of the earth and sees everything under the heavens.

25.text: When God fixed the weight of the wind and measured out the waters,

26.text: when He set a limit for the rain and a path for the thunderbolt,

27.text: then He looked at wisdom and appraised it; He established it and searched it out.

28.text: And He said to man, ‘Behold, the fear of the Lord, that is wisdom, and to turn away from evil is understanding.’”
